# NSTitlebarAccessoryViewController

**Class**

An object that manages a custom view—known as an accessory view—in the title bar–toolbar area of a window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class NSTitlebarAccessoryViewController
```

## Overview

Because a title bar accessory view controller is contained in a visual effect view (that is, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSVisualEffectView]), it automatically handles the blur behind the accessory view and the size and location changes for the content of the view when a window goes in and out of full screen mode. If you’re currently using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSToolbar] fullscreen accessory APIs, such as [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSToolbar/fullScreenAccessoryView], you should use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTitlebarAccessoryViewController] APIs instead.

Typically, you create an `NSTitlebarAccessoryViewController` object, give it your custom view, set the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTitlebarAccessoryViewController/layoutAttribute] property to ensure that it displays correctly in relation to the title bar, and add the view controller to your window. For more information about [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow] methods you can use to add and remove a title bar accessory view controller, see Managing Title Bars.

Don’t override the `view` property in your `NSTitlebarAccessoryViewController` subclass. Instead, you can override [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/loadView()], and set the `view` property in that method.



## Configuring a Title Bar Accessory View Controller

- **fullScreenMinHeight**: The visual minimum height of an accessory view that displays below the title bar when the window is in full screen mode.
- **layoutAttribute**: The location of the accessory view, in relation to the window’s title bar.

## Responding to View Events

- **viewDidAppear()**: Called when the title bar accessory view controller’s view is fully transitioned onto the screen.
- **viewDidDisappear()**: Called after the title bar accessory view controller’s view is removed from the window’s view hierarchy.
- **viewWillAppear()**: Called after the title bar accessory view controller’s view has been loaded into memory is about to be added to the view hierarchy in the window.

## Instance Properties

- **automaticallyAdjustsSize**
- **isHidden**
- **preferredScrollEdgeEffectStyle**: The titlebar accessory’s preferred effect for content scrolling behind it.

## Content Controllers

- **NSWindowController**: A controller that manages a window, usually a window stored in a nib file.
- **NSViewController**: A controller that manages a view, typically loaded from a nib file.

## Inherits From

- NSViewController
